_header: Wine of nature properties hath nine
Note: A Latin version is in Cambridge UK, Trinity College O.9.38 (1450) line 2 same as line 1969 of 1544. Cf. 3672.
_description: On the properties of wine — one 8-line stanza (ababbcbc)

BodAuct7Q221.First Lines:
Wyn of Nature hath properties ixIt comfortith þe hert it
                    clerith þe sigth…
BodAuct7Q221.Last Lines:
…he that is wise wil not it forsakeSo the wyn be goode &
                    mesurably take
BodAuct7Q221.Note: Written onto end papers. Variant: two stanzas rhyme royal.
BodAuct7Q221.Editions:
Mooney,  Linne R. 
             “Practical Didactic Works in Middle English.” 
         Diss. Toronto, 1981: 447-8.

BLAdd10106.Transcription:
Wyne of natur propurtees hath nyneComfortith courage and clarifieth
                    sightGladith the hert licour moost dyvyneHetith the stomake of his
                    naturell myghtLicour of licours at festis makith men lightClensith
                    woondis engendrith gentil blodeScowrith the palet so feble heedis makith
                    wode
BLAdd10106.Note:
7 lines, rearranged; added to MS flyleaf by a late fifteenth-century
                    hand.
BLAdd10106.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 1.325.
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. II: Secular Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 192 (1934); repr. 1961: 724.

BLAdd29729.First Lines:
Wyne of nature hathe properties nynecomfortythe coragis clarifiethe
                    the syght…
BLAdd29729.Last Lines:
…licor of licor at festis makyth men lyghtscowrethþe
                    palat throwgh fyne þe color good
BLAdd29729.Attributed Title:
The ix properties of wyne per Johannem lidgate (as heading, f. 16); the
                    nyne properties of wyne per Johannem lidgate (below last line, f. 1), both by
                    scribe (John Stow)
BLAdd29729.Editions:
Steele,  Robert,
                        ed.  
             Lydgate and Burgh’s Secrees of Old Philisoffres: A version of the
                ‘Secreta Secretorum’.
EETS

MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. II: Secular Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 192 (1934); repr. 1961: 724.

BLHar2252.First Lines:
Wyne of hys nature hathe propertes ixComfortythe Coragythe
                    claryfyethe þe syghte…
BLHar2252.Last Lines:
…Lycowr of licour whyche makythe men lyghteModeratly taken hyt
                    dothe a man myche good
BLHar2252.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. II: Secular Poems.
EETS
